Browse the source code of netbsd/external/ibm-public/postfix/dist/src/postscreen/postscreen_smtpd.c

1/* $NetBSD: postscreen_smtpd.c,v 1.2 2017/02/14 01:16:47 christos Exp $ */
2
3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* postscreen_smtpd 3
6/* SUMMARY
7/* postscreen built-in SMTP server engine
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* #include <postscreen.h>
10/*
11/* void psc_smtpd_pre_jail_init(void)
12/*
13/* void psc_smtpd_init(void)
14/*
15/* void psc_smtpd_tests(state)
16/* PSC_STATE *state;
17/*
18/* void PSC_SMTPD_X21(state, final_reply)
19/* PSC_STATE *state;
20/* const char *final_reply;
21/* DESCRIPTION
22/* psc_smtpd_pre_jail_init() performs one-time per-process
23/* initialization during the "before chroot" execution phase.
24/*
25/* psc_smtpd_init() performs one-time per-process initialization.
26/*
27/* psc_smtpd_tests() starts up an SMTP server engine for deep
28/* protocol tests and for collecting helo/sender/recipient
29/* information.
30/*
31/* PSC_SMTPD_X21() redirects the SMTP client to an SMTP server
32/* engine, which sends the specified final reply at the first
33/* legitimate opportunity without doing any protocol tests.
34/*
35/* Unlike the Postfix SMTP server, this engine does not announce
36/* PIPELINING support. This exposes spambots that pipeline
37/* their commands anyway. Like the Postfix SMTP server, this
38/* engine will accept input with bare newline characters. To
39/* pass the "pipelining" and "bare newline" test, the client
40/* has to properly speak SMTP all the way to the RCPT TO
41/* command. These tests fail if the client violates the protocol
42/* at any stage.
43/*
44/* No support is announced for AUTH, XCLIENT or XFORWARD.
45/* Clients that need this should be whitelisted or should talk
46/* directly to the submission service.
47/*
48/* The engine rejects RCPT TO and VRFY commands with the
49/* state->rcpt_reply response which depends on program history,
50/* rejects ETRN with a generic response, and closes the
51/* connection after QUIT.
52/*
53/* Since this engine defers or rejects all non-junk commands,
54/* there is no point maintaining separate counters for "error"
55/* commands and "junk" commands. Instead, the engine maintains
56/* a per-session command counter, and terminates the session
57/* with a 421 reply when the command count exceeds the limit.
58/*
59/* We limit the command count, as well as the total time to
60/* receive a command. This limits the time per client more
61/* effectively than would be possible with read() timeouts.
62/*
63/* There is no concern about getting blocked on output. The
64/* psc_send() routine uses non-blocking output, and discards
65/* output that the client is not willing to receive.
66/* PROTOCOL INSPECTION VERSUS CONTENT INSPECTION
67/* The goal of postscreen is to keep spambots away from Postfix.
68/* To recognize spambots, postscreen measures properties of
69/* the client IP address and of the client SMTP protocol
70/* implementation. These client properties don't change with
71/* each delivery attempt. Therefore it is possible to make a
72/* long-term decision after a single measurement. For example,
73/* allow a good client to skip the DNSBL test for 24 hours,
74/* or to skip the pipelining test for one week.
75/*
76/* If postscreen were to measure properties of message content
77/* (MIME compliance, etc.) then it would measure properties
78/* that may change with each delivery attempt. Here, it would
79/* be wrong to make a long-term decision after a single
80/* measurement. Instead, postscreen would need to develop a
81/* ranking based on the content of multiple messages from the
82/* same client.
83/*
84/* Many spambots avoid spamming the same site repeatedly.
85/* Thus, postscreen must make decisions after a single
86/* measurement. Message content is not a good indicator for
87/* making long-term decisions after single measurements, and
88/* that is why postscreen does not inspect message content.
89/* REJECTING RCPT TO VERSUS SENDING LIVE SOCKETS TO SMTPD(8)
90/* When post-handshake protocol tests are enabled, postscreen
91/* rejects the RCPT TO command from a good client, and forces
92/* it to deliver mail in a later session. This is why
93/* post-handshake protocol tests have a longer expiration time
94/* than pre-handshake tests.
95/*
96/* Instead, postscreen could send the network socket to smtpd(8)
97/* and ship the session history (including TLS and other SMTP
98/* or non-SMTP attributes) as auxiliary data. The Postfix SMTP
99/* server would then use new code to replay the session history,
100/* and would use existing code to validate the client, helo,
101/* sender and recipient address.
102/*
103/* Such an approach would increase the implementation and
104/* maintenance effort, because:
105/*
106/* 1) New replay code would be needed in smtpd(8), such that
107/* the HELO, EHLO, and MAIL command handlers can delay their
108/* error responses until the RCPT TO reply.
109/*
110/* 2) postscreen(8) would have to implement more of smtpd(8)'s
111/* syntax checks, to avoid confusing delayed "syntax error"
112/* and other error responses syntax error responses while
113/* replaying history.
114/*
115/* 3) New code would be needed in postscreen(8) and smtpd(8)
116/* to send and receive the session history (including TLS and
117/* other SMTP or non-SMTP attributes) as auxiliary data while
118/* sending the network socket from postscreen(8) to smtpd(8).
119/* REJECTING RCPT TO VERSUS PROXYING LIVE SESSIONS TO SMTPD(8)
120/* An alternative would be to proxy the session history to a
121/* real Postfix SMTP process, presumably passing TLS and other
122/* attributes via an extended XCLIENT implementation. That
123/* would require all the work described in 2) above, plus
124/* duplication of all the features of the smtpd(8) TLS engine,
125/* plus additional XCLIENT support for a lot more attributes.
126/* LICENSE
127/* .ad
128/* .fi
129/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
130/* AUTHOR(S)
131/* Wietse Venema
132/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
133/* P.O. Box 704
134/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
135/*--*/
136
137/* System library. */
138

140#include <string.h>
141#include <ctype.h>
142
143#ifdef STRCASECMP_IN_STRINGS_H
144#include <strings.h>
145#endif
146
147/* Utility library. */
148
149#include <msg.h>
150#include <stringops.h>
151#include <mymalloc.h>
152#include <iostuff.h>
153#include <vstring.h>
154
155/* Global library. */
156
157#include <mail_params.h>
158#include <mail_proto.h>
159#include <is_header.h>
160#include <string_list.h>
161#include <maps.h>
162#include <ehlo_mask.h>
163#include <lex_822.h>
164
165/* TLS library. */
166
167#include <tls.h>
168
169/* Application-specific. */
170
171#include <postscreen.h>
172
173 /*
174 * Plan for future body processing. See smtp-sink.c. For now, we have no
175 * per-session push-back except for the single-character push-back that
176 * VSTREAM guarantees after we read one character.
177 */
178#define PSC_SMTPD_HAVE_PUSH_BACK(state) (0)
179#define PSC_SMTPD_PUSH_BACK_CHAR(state, ch) \
180 vstream_ungetc((state)->smtp_client_stream, (ch))
181#define PSC_SMTPD_NEXT_CHAR(state) \
182 VSTREAM_GETC((state)->smtp_client_stream)
183
184#define PSC_SMTPD_BUFFER_EMPTY(state) \
185 (!PSC_SMTPD_HAVE_PUSH_BACK(state) \
186 && vstream_peek((state)->smtp_client_stream) <= 0)
187
188#define PSC_SMTPD_PEEK_DATA(state) \
189 vstream_peek_data((state)->smtp_client_stream)
190#define PSC_SMTPD_PEEK_LEN(state) \
191 vstream_peek((state)->smtp_client_stream)
192
193 /*
194 * Dynamic reply strings. To minimize overhead we format these once.
195 */
196static char *psc_smtpd_greeting; /* smtp banner */
197static char *psc_smtpd_helo_reply; /* helo reply */
198static char *psc_smtpd_ehlo_reply_plain;/* multi-line ehlo reply, non-TLS */
199static char *psc_smtpd_ehlo_reply_tls; /* multi-line ehlo reply, with TLS */
200static char *psc_smtpd_timeout_reply; /* timeout reply */
201static char *psc_smtpd_421_reply; /* generic final_reply value */
202
203 /*
204 * Forward declaration, needed by PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_REQUEST.
205 */
206static void psc_smtpd_time_event(int, void *);
207static void psc_smtpd_read_event(int, void *);
208
209 /*
210 * Encapsulation. The STARTTLS, EHLO and AUTH command handlers temporarily
211 * suspend SMTP command events, send an asynchronous proxy request, and
212 * resume SMTP command events after receiving the asynchrounous proxy
213 * response (the EHLO handler must asynchronously talk to the auth server
214 * before it can announce the SASL mechanism list; the list can depend on
215 * the client IP address and on the presence on TLS encryption).
216 */
217#define PSC_RESUME_SMTP_CMD_EVENTS(state) do { \
218 PSC_READ_EVENT_REQUEST2(vstream_fileno((state)->smtp_client_stream), \
219 psc_smtpd_read_event, psc_smtpd_time_event, \
220 (void *) (state), PSC_EFF_CMD_TIME_LIMIT); \
221 if (!PSC_SMTPD_BUFFER_EMPTY(state)) \
222 psc_smtpd_read_event(EVENT_READ, (void *) state); \
223 } while (0)
224
225#define PSC_SUSPEND_SMTP_CMD_EVENTS(state) \
226 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_REQUEST(vstream_fileno((state)->smtp_client_stream), \
227 psc_smtpd_time_event, (void *) (state));
228
229 /*
230 * Make control characters and other non-text visible.
231 */
232#define PSC_SMTPD_ESCAPE_TEXT(dest, src, src_len, max_len) do { \
233 ssize_t _s_len = (src_len); \
234 ssize_t _m_len = (max_len); \
235 (void) escape((dest), (src), _s_len < _m_len ? _s_len : _m_len); \
236 } while (0)
237
238 /*
239 * Command parser support.
240 */
241#define PSC_SMTPD_NEXT_TOKEN(ptr) mystrtok(&(ptr), " ")
242
243 /*
244 * EHLO keyword filter
245 */
246static MAPS *psc_ehlo_discard_maps;
247static int psc_ehlo_discard_mask;
248
249 /*
250 * Command editing filter.
251 */
252static DICT *psc_cmd_filter;
253
254 /*
255 * Encapsulation. We must not forget turn off input/timer events when we
256 * terminate the SMTP protocol engine.
257 *
258 * It would be safer to turn off input/timer events after each event, and to
259 * turn on input/timer events again when we want more input. But experience
260 * with the Postfix smtp-source and smtp-sink tools shows that this would
261 * noticeably increase the run-time cost.
262 */
263#define PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_DROP_SESSION_STATE(state, event, reply) do { \
264 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_REQUEST(vstream_fileno((state)->smtp_client_stream), \
265 (event), (void *) (state)); \
266 PSC_DROP_SESSION_STATE((state), (reply)); \
267 } while (0);
268
269#define PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_HANGUP(state, event) do { \
270 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_REQUEST(vstream_fileno((state)->smtp_client_stream), \
271 (event), (void *) (state)); \
272 psc_hangup_event(state); \
273 } while (0);
274
275/* psc_helo_cmd - record HELO and respond */
276
277static int psc_helo_cmd(PSC_STATE *state, char *args)
278{
279 char *helo_name = PSC_SMTPD_NEXT_TOKEN(args);
280
281 /*
282 * smtpd(8) incompatibility: we ignore extra words; smtpd(8) saves them.
283 */
284 if (helo_name == 0)
285 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state, "501 Syntax: HELO hostname\r\n"));
286
287 PSC_STRING_UPDATE(state->helo_name, helo_name);
288 PSC_STRING_RESET(state->sender);
289 /* Don't downgrade state->protocol, in case some test depends on this. */
290 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state, psc_smtpd_helo_reply));
291}
292
293/* psc_smtpd_format_ehlo_reply - format EHLO response */
294
295static void psc_smtpd_format_ehlo_reply(VSTRING *buf, int discard_mask
296 /* , const char *sasl_mechanism_list */ )
297{
298 const char *myname = "psc_smtpd_format_ehlo_reply";
299 int saved_len = 0;
300
301 if (msg_verbose)
302 msg_info("%s: discard_mask %s", myname, str_ehlo_mask(discard_mask));
303
304#define PSC_EHLO_APPEND(save, buf, fmt) do { \
305 (save) = LEN(buf); \
306 vstring_sprintf_append((buf), (fmt)); \
307 } while (0)
308
309#define PSC_EHLO_APPEND1(save, buf, fmt, arg1) do { \
310 (save) = LEN(buf); \
311 vstring_sprintf_append((buf), (fmt), (arg1)); \
312 } while (0)
313
314 vstring_sprintf(psc_temp, "250-%s\r\n", var_myhostname);
315 if ((discard_mask & EHLO_MASK_SIZE) == 0) {
316 if (var_message_limit)
317 PSC_EHLO_APPEND1(saved_len, psc_temp, "250-SIZE %lu\r\n",
318 (unsigned long) var_message_limit);
319 else
320 PSC_EHLO_APPEND(saved_len, psc_temp, "250-SIZE\r\n");
321 }
322 if ((discard_mask & EHLO_MASK_VRFY) == 0 && var_disable_vrfy_cmd == 0)
323 PSC_EHLO_APPEND(saved_len, psc_temp, "250-VRFY\r\n");
324 if ((discard_mask & EHLO_MASK_ETRN) == 0)
325 PSC_EHLO_APPEND(saved_len, psc_temp, "250-ETRN\r\n");
326 if ((discard_mask & EHLO_MASK_STARTTLS) == 0 && var_psc_use_tls)
327 PSC_EHLO_APPEND(saved_len, psc_temp, "250-STARTTLS\r\n");
328#ifdef TODO_SASL_AUTH
329 if ((discard_mask & EHLO_MASK_AUTH) == 0 && sasl_mechanism_list
330 && (!var_psc_tls_auth_only || (discard_mask & EHLO_MASK_STARTTLS))) {
331 PSC_EHLO_APPEND1(saved_len, psc_temp, "AUTH %s", sasl_mechanism_list);
332 if (var_broken_auth_clients)
333 PSC_EHLO_APPEND1(saved_len, psc_temp, "AUTH=%s", sasl_mechanism_list);
334 }
335#endif
336 if ((discard_mask & EHLO_MASK_ENHANCEDSTATUSCODES) == 0)
337 PSC_EHLO_APPEND(saved_len, psc_temp, "250-ENHANCEDSTATUSCODES\r\n");
338 if ((discard_mask & EHLO_MASK_8BITMIME) == 0)
339 PSC_EHLO_APPEND(saved_len, psc_temp, "250-8BITMIME\r\n");
340 if ((discard_mask & EHLO_MASK_DSN) == 0)
341 PSC_EHLO_APPEND(saved_len, psc_temp, "250-DSN\r\n");
342 /* Fix 20140708: announce SMTPUTF8. */
343 if (var_smtputf8_enable && (discard_mask & EHLO_MASK_SMTPUTF8) == 0)
344 PSC_EHLO_APPEND(saved_len, psc_temp, "250-SMTPUTF8\r\n");
345 STR(psc_temp)[saved_len + 3] = ' ';
346}
347
348/* psc_ehlo_cmd - record EHLO and respond */
349
350static int psc_ehlo_cmd(PSC_STATE *state, char *args)
351{
352 char *helo_name = PSC_SMTPD_NEXT_TOKEN(args);
353 const char *ehlo_words;
354 int discard_mask;
355 char *reply;
356
357 /*
358 * smtpd(8) incompatibility: we ignore extra words; smtpd(8) saves them.
359 */
360 if (helo_name == 0)
361 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state, "501 Syntax: EHLO hostname\r\n"));
362
363 PSC_STRING_UPDATE(state->helo_name, helo_name);
364 PSC_STRING_RESET(state->sender);
365 state->protocol = MAIL_PROTO_ESMTP;
366
367 /*
368 * smtpd(8) compatibility: dynamic reply filtering.
369 */
370 if (psc_ehlo_discard_maps != 0
371 && (ehlo_words = psc_maps_find(psc_ehlo_discard_maps,
372 state->smtp_client_addr, 0)) != 0
373 && (discard_mask = ehlo_mask(ehlo_words)) != psc_ehlo_discard_mask) {
374 if (discard_mask && !(discard_mask & EHLO_MASK_SILENT))
375 msg_info("[%s]%s: discarding EHLO keywords: %s",
376 PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state), str_ehlo_mask(discard_mask));
377 if (state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_USING_TLS)
378 discard_mask |= EHLO_MASK_STARTTLS;
379 psc_smtpd_format_ehlo_reply(psc_temp, discard_mask);
380 reply = STR(psc_temp);
381 state->ehlo_discard_mask = discard_mask;
382 } else if (psc_ehlo_discard_maps && psc_ehlo_discard_maps->error) {
383 msg_fatal("%s lookup error for %s",
384 psc_ehlo_discard_maps->title, state->smtp_client_addr);
385 } else if (state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_USING_TLS) {
386 reply = psc_smtpd_ehlo_reply_tls;
387 state->ehlo_discard_mask = psc_ehlo_discard_mask | EHLO_MASK_STARTTLS;
388 } else {
389 reply = psc_smtpd_ehlo_reply_plain;
390 state->ehlo_discard_mask = psc_ehlo_discard_mask;
391 }
392 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state, reply));
393}
394
395/* psc_starttls_resume - resume the SMTP protocol after tlsproxy activation */
396
397static void psc_starttls_resume(int unused_event, void *context)
398{
399 const char *myname = "psc_starttls_resume";
400 PSC_STATE *state = (PSC_STATE *) context;
401
402 /*
403 * Reset SMTP server state if STARTTLS was successful.
404 */
405 if (state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_USING_TLS) {
406 /* Purge the push-back buffer, when implemented. */
407 PSC_STRING_RESET(state->helo_name);
408 PSC_STRING_RESET(state->sender);
409#ifdef TODO_SASL_AUTH
410 /* Reset SASL AUTH state. Dovecot responses may change. */
411#endif
412 }
413
414 /*
415 * Resume read/timeout events. If we still have unread input, resume the
416 * command processor immediately.
417 */
418 PSC_RESUME_SMTP_CMD_EVENTS(state);
419}
420
421/* psc_starttls_cmd - activate the tlsproxy server */
422
423static int psc_starttls_cmd(PSC_STATE *state, char *args)
424{
425 const char *myname = "psc_starttls_cmd";
426
427 /*
428 * smtpd(8) incompatibility: we can't send a 4XX reply that TLS is
429 * unavailable when tlsproxy(8) detects the problem too late.
430 */
431 if (PSC_SMTPD_NEXT_TOKEN(args) != 0)
432 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state, "501 Syntax: EHLO hostname\r\n"));
433 if (state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_USING_TLS)
434 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
435 "554 5.5.1 Error: TLS already active\r\n"));
436 if (var_psc_use_tls == 0 || (state->ehlo_discard_mask & EHLO_MASK_STARTTLS))
437 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
438 "502 5.5.1 Error: command not implemented\r\n"));
439
440 /*
441 * Suspend the SMTP protocol until psc_starttls_resume() is called.
442 */
443 PSC_SUSPEND_SMTP_CMD_EVENTS(state);
444 psc_starttls_open(state, psc_starttls_resume);
445 return (0);
446}
447
448/* psc_extract_addr - extract MAIL/RCPT address, unquoted form */
449
450static char *psc_extract_addr(VSTRING *result, const char *string)
451{
452 const unsigned char *cp = (const unsigned char *) string;
453 char *addr;
454 char *colon;
455 int stop_at;
456 int inquote = 0;
457
458 /*
459 * smtpd(8) incompatibility: we allow more invalid address forms, and we
460 * don't validate recipients. We are not going to deliver them so we
461 * won't have to worry about deliverability. This may have to change when
462 * we pass the socket to a real SMTP server and replay message envelope
463 * commands.
464 */
465
466 /* Skip SP characters. */
467 while (*cp && *cp == ' ')
468 cp++;
469
470 /* Choose the terminator for <addr> or bare addr. */
471 if (*cp == '<') {
472 cp++;
473 stop_at = '>';
474 } else {
475 stop_at = ' ';
476 }
477
478 /* Skip to terminator or end. */
479 VSTRING_RESET(result);
480 for ( /* void */ ; *cp; cp++) {
481 if (!inquote && *cp == stop_at)
482 break;
483 if (*cp == '"') {
484 inquote = !inquote;
485 } else {
486 if (*cp == '\\' && *++cp == 0)
487 break;
488 VSTRING_ADDCH(result, *cp);
489 }
490 }
491 VSTRING_TERMINATE(result);
492
493 /*
494 * smtpd(8) compatibility: truncate deprecated route address form. This
495 * is primarily to simplify logfile analysis.
496 */
497 addr = STR(result);
498 if (*addr == '@' && (colon = strchr(addr, ':')) != 0)
499 addr = colon + 1;
500 return (addr);
501}
502
503/* psc_mail_cmd - record MAIL and respond */
504
505static int psc_mail_cmd(PSC_STATE *state, char *args)
506{
507 char *colon;
508 char *addr;
509
510 /*
511 * smtpd(8) incompatibility: we never reject the sender, and we ignore
512 * additional arguments.
513 */
514 if (var_psc_helo_required && state->helo_name == 0)
515 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
516 "503 5.5.1 Error: send HELO/EHLO first\r\n"));
517 if (state->sender != 0)
518 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
519 "503 5.5.1 Error: nested MAIL command\r\n"));
520 if (args == 0 || (colon = strchr(args, ':')) == 0)
521 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
522 "501 5.5.4 Syntax: MAIL FROM:<address>\r\n"));
523 if ((addr = psc_extract_addr(psc_temp, colon + 1)) == 0)
524 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
525 "501 5.1.7 Bad sender address syntax\r\n"));
526 PSC_STRING_UPDATE(state->sender, addr);
527 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state, "250 2.1.0 Ok\r\n"));
528}
529
530/* psc_soften_reply - copy and soft-bounce a reply */
531
532static char *psc_soften_reply(const char *reply)
533{
534 static VSTRING *buf = 0;
535
536 if (buf == 0)
537 buf = vstring_alloc(100);
538 vstring_strcpy(buf, reply);
539 if (reply[0] == '5')
540 STR(buf)[0] = '4';
541 if (reply[4] == '5')
542 STR(buf)[4] = '4';
543 return (STR(buf));
544}
545
546/* psc_rcpt_cmd record RCPT and respond */
547
548static int psc_rcpt_cmd(PSC_STATE *state, char *args)
549{
550 char *colon;
551 char *addr;
552
553 /*
554 * smtpd(8) incompatibility: we reject all recipients, and ignore
555 * additional arguments.
556 */
557 if (state->sender == 0)
558 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
559 "503 5.5.1 Error: need MAIL command\r\n"));
560 if (args == 0 || (colon = strchr(args, ':')) == 0)
561 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
562 "501 5.5.4 Syntax: RCPT TO:<address>\r\n"));
563 if ((addr = psc_extract_addr(psc_temp, colon + 1)) == 0)
564 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
565 "501 5.1.3 Bad recipient address syntax\r\n"));
566 msg_info("NOQUEUE: reject: RCPT from [%s]:%s: %.*s; "
567 "from=<%s>, to=<%s>, proto=%s, helo=<%s>",
568 PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state),
569 (int) strlen(state->rcpt_reply) - 2,
570 var_soft_bounce == 0 ? state->rcpt_reply :
571 psc_soften_reply(state->rcpt_reply),
572 state->sender, addr, state->protocol,
573 state->helo_name ? state->helo_name : "");
574 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state, state->rcpt_reply));
575}
576
577/* psc_data_cmd - respond to DATA and disconnect */
578
579static int psc_data_cmd(PSC_STATE *state, char *args)
580{
581
582 /*
583 * smtpd(8) incompatibility: we reject all requests.
584 */
585 if (PSC_SMTPD_NEXT_TOKEN(args) != 0)
586 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
587 "501 5.5.4 Syntax: DATA\r\n"));
588 if (state->sender == 0)
589 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
590 "503 5.5.1 Error: need RCPT command\r\n"));
591
592 /*
593 * We really would like to hang up the connection as early as possible,
594 * so that we dont't have to deal with broken zombies that fall silent at
595 * the first reject response. For now we rely on stress-dependent command
596 * read timeouts.
597 *
598 * If we proceed into the data phase, enforce over-all DATA time limit.
599 */
600 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
601 "554 5.5.1 Error: no valid recipients\r\n"));
602}
603
604/* psc_rset_cmd - reset, send 250 OK */
605
606static int psc_rset_cmd(PSC_STATE *state, char *unused_args)
607{
608 PSC_STRING_RESET(state->sender);
609 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state, "250 2.0.0 Ok\r\n"));
610}
611
612/* psc_noop_cmd - respond to something */
613
614static int psc_noop_cmd(PSC_STATE *state, char *unused_args)
615{
616 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state, "250 2.0.0 Ok\r\n"));
617}
618
619/* psc_vrfy_cmd - respond to VRFY */
620
621static int psc_vrfy_cmd(PSC_STATE *state, char *args)
622{
623
624 /*
625 * smtpd(8) incompatibility: we reject all requests, and ignore
626 * additional arguments.
627 */
628 if (PSC_SMTPD_NEXT_TOKEN(args) == 0)
629 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
630 "501 5.5.4 Syntax: VRFY address\r\n"));
631 if (var_psc_disable_vrfy)
632 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
633 "502 5.5.1 VRFY command is disabled\r\n"));
634 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state, state->rcpt_reply));
635}
636
637/* psc_etrn_cmd - reset, send 250 OK */
638
639static int psc_etrn_cmd(PSC_STATE *state, char *args)
640{
641
642 /*
643 * smtpd(8) incompatibility: we reject all requests, and ignore
644 * additional arguments.
645 */
646 if (var_psc_helo_required && state->helo_name == 0)
647 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
648 "503 5.5.1 Error: send HELO/EHLO first\r\n"));
649 if (PSC_SMTPD_NEXT_TOKEN(args) == 0)
650 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
651 "500 Syntax: ETRN domain\r\n"));
652 return (PSC_SEND_REPLY(state, "458 Unable to queue messages\r\n"));
653}
654
655/* psc_quit_cmd - respond to QUIT and disconnect */
656
657static int psc_quit_cmd(PSC_STATE *state, char *unused_args)
658{
659 const char *myname = "psc_quit_cmd";
660
661 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_DROP_SESSION_STATE(state, psc_smtpd_time_event,
662 "221 2.0.0 Bye\r\n");
663 /* Caution: state is now a dangling pointer. */
664 return (0);
665}
666
667/* psc_smtpd_time_event - handle per-session time limit */
668
669static void psc_smtpd_time_event(int event, void *context)
670{
671 const char *myname = "psc_smtpd_time_event";
672 PSC_STATE *state = (PSC_STATE *) context;
673
674 if (msg_verbose > 1)
675 msg_info("%s: sq=%d cq=%d event %d on smtp socket %d from [%s]:%s flags=%s",
676 myname, psc_post_queue_length, psc_check_queue_length,
677 event, vstream_fileno(state->smtp_client_stream),
678 state->smtp_client_addr, state->smtp_client_port,
679 psc_print_state_flags(state->flags, myname));
680
681 msg_info("COMMAND TIME LIMIT from [%s]:%s after %s",
682 PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state), state->where);
683 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_DROP_SESSION_STATE(state, psc_smtpd_time_event,
684 psc_smtpd_timeout_reply);
685}
686
687 /*
688 * The table of all SMTP commands that we know.
689 */
690typedef struct {
691 const char *name;
692 int (*action) (PSC_STATE *, char *);
693 int flags; /* see below */
694} PSC_SMTPD_COMMAND;
695
696#define PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_NONE (0) /* no flags (i.e. disabled) */
697#define PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_ENABLE (1<<0) /* command is enabled */
698#define PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_DESTROY (1<<1) /* dangling pointer alert */
699#define PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_PRE_TLS (1<<2) /* allowed with mandatory TLS */
700#define PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_SUSPEND (1<<3) /* suspend command engine */
701
702static const PSC_SMTPD_COMMAND command_table[] = {
703 "HELO", psc_helo_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_ENABLE | PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_PRE_TLS,
704 "EHLO", psc_ehlo_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_ENABLE | PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_PRE_TLS,
705 "STARTTLS", psc_starttls_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_ENABLE | PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_PRE_TLS | PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_SUSPEND,
706 "XCLIENT", psc_noop_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_NONE,
707 "XFORWARD", psc_noop_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_NONE,
708 "AUTH", psc_noop_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_NONE,
709 "MAIL", psc_mail_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_ENABLE,
710 "RCPT", psc_rcpt_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_ENABLE,
711 "DATA", psc_data_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_ENABLE,
712 /* ".", psc_dot_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_NONE, */
713 "RSET", psc_rset_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_ENABLE,
714 "NOOP", psc_noop_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_ENABLE | PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_PRE_TLS,
715 "VRFY", psc_vrfy_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_ENABLE,
716 "ETRN", psc_etrn_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_ENABLE,
717 "QUIT", psc_quit_cmd, PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_ENABLE | PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_DESTROY | PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_PRE_TLS,
718 0,
719};
720
721/* psc_smtpd_read_event - pseudo responder */
722
723static void psc_smtpd_read_event(int event, void *context)
724{
725 const char *myname = "psc_smtpd_read_event";
726 PSC_STATE *state = (PSC_STATE *) context;
727 int ch;
728 struct cmd_trans {
729 int state;
730 int want;
731 int next_state;
732 };
733 const char *saved_where;
734
735#define PSC_SMTPD_CMD_ST_ANY 0
736#define PSC_SMTPD_CMD_ST_CR 1
737#define PSC_SMTPD_CMD_ST_CR_LF 2
738
739 static const struct cmd_trans cmd_trans[] = {
740 PSC_SMTPD_CMD_ST_ANY, '\r', PSC_SMTPD_CMD_ST_CR,
741 PSC_SMTPD_CMD_ST_CR, '\n', PSC_SMTPD_CMD_ST_CR_LF,
742 0, 0, 0,
743 };
744 const struct cmd_trans *transp;
745 char *cmd_buffer_ptr;
746 char *command;
747 const PSC_SMTPD_COMMAND *cmdp;
748 int write_stat;
749
750 if (msg_verbose > 1)
751 msg_info("%s: sq=%d cq=%d event %d on smtp socket %d from [%s]:%s flags=%s",
752 myname, psc_post_queue_length, psc_check_queue_length,
753 event, vstream_fileno(state->smtp_client_stream),
754 state->smtp_client_addr, state->smtp_client_port,
755 psc_print_state_flags(state->flags, myname));
756
757 /*
758 * Basic liveness requirements.
759 *
760 * Drain all input in the VSTREAM buffer, otherwise this socket will not
761 * receive further read event notification until the client disconnects!
762 *
763 * To suspend this loop temporarily before the buffer is drained, use the
764 * PSC_SUSPEND_SMTP_CMD_EVENTS() and PSC_RESUME_SMTP_CMD_EVENTS() macros,
765 * and set the PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_SUSPEND flag in the command table.
766 *
767 * Don't try to read input before it has arrived, otherwise we would starve
768 * the pseudo threads of other sessions. Get out of here as soon as the
769 * VSTREAM read buffer dries up. Do not look for more input in kernel
770 * buffers. That input wasn't likely there when psc_smtpd_read_event()
771 * was called. Also, yielding the pseudo thread will improve fairness for
772 * other pseudo threads.
773 */
774
775 /*
776 * Note: on entry into this function the VSTREAM buffer may or may not be
777 * empty, so we test the "no more input" condition at the bottom of the
778 * loops.
779 */
780 for (;;) {
781
782 /*
783 * Read one command line, possibly one fragment at a time.
784 */
785 for (;;) {
786
787 if ((ch = PSC_SMTPD_NEXT_CHAR(state)) == VSTREAM_EOF) {
788 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_HANGUP(state, psc_smtpd_time_event);
789 return;
790 }
791
792 /*
793 * Sanity check. We don't want to store infinitely long commands.
794 */
795 if (state->read_state == PSC_SMTPD_CMD_ST_ANY
796 && VSTRING_LEN(state->cmd_buffer) >= var_line_limit) {
797 msg_info("COMMAND LENGTH LIMIT from [%s]:%s after %s",
798 PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state), state->where);
799 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_DROP_SESSION_STATE(state, psc_smtpd_time_event,
800 psc_smtpd_421_reply);
801 return;
802 }
803 VSTRING_ADDCH(state->cmd_buffer, ch);
804
805 /*
806 * Try to match the current character desired by the state
807 * machine. If that fails, try to restart the machine with a
808 * match for its first state. Like smtpd(8), we understand lines
809 * ending in <CR><LF> and bare <LF>. Unlike smtpd(8), we may
810 * treat lines ending in bare <LF> as an offense.
811 */
812 for (transp = cmd_trans; transp->state != state->read_state; transp++)
813 if (transp->want == 0)
814 msg_panic("%s: command_read: unknown state: %d",
815 myname, state->read_state);
816 if (ch == transp->want)
817 state->read_state = transp->next_state;
818 else if (ch == cmd_trans[0].want)
819 state->read_state = cmd_trans[0].next_state;
820 else
821 state->read_state = PSC_SMTPD_CMD_ST_ANY;
822 if (state->read_state == PSC_SMTPD_CMD_ST_CR_LF) {
823 vstring_truncate(state->cmd_buffer,
824 VSTRING_LEN(state->cmd_buffer) - 2);
825 break;
826 }
827
828 /*
829 * Bare newline test.
830 */
831 if (ch == '\n') {
832 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_BARLF_TODO_SKIP)
833 == PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_TODO) {
834 PSC_SMTPD_ESCAPE_TEXT(psc_temp, STR(state->cmd_buffer),
835 VSTRING_LEN(state->cmd_buffer) - 1, 100);
836 msg_info("BARE NEWLINE from [%s]:%s after %s",
837 PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state), STR(psc_temp));
838 PSC_FAIL_SESSION_STATE(state, PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_FAIL);
839 PSC_UNPASS_SESSION_STATE(state, PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_PASS);
840 state->barlf_stamp = PSC_TIME_STAMP_DISABLED; /* XXX */
841 /* Skip this test for the remainder of this session. */
842 PSC_SKIP_SESSION_STATE(state, "bare newline test",
843 PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_SKIP);
844 switch (psc_barlf_action) {
845 case PSC_ACT_DROP:
846 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_DROP_SESSION_STATE(state,
847 psc_smtpd_time_event,
848 "521 5.5.1 Protocol error\r\n");
849 return;
850 case PSC_ACT_ENFORCE:
851 PSC_ENFORCE_SESSION_STATE(state,
852 "550 5.5.1 Protocol error\r\n");
853 break;
854 case PSC_ACT_IGNORE:
855 PSC_UNFAIL_SESSION_STATE(state,
856 PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_FAIL);
857 /* Temporarily whitelist until something expires. */
858 PSC_PASS_SESSION_STATE(state, "bare newline test",
859 PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_PASS);
860 state->barlf_stamp = event_time() + psc_min_ttl;
861 break;
862 default:
863 msg_panic("%s: unknown bare_newline action value %d",
864 myname, psc_barlf_action);
865 }
866 }
867 vstring_truncate(state->cmd_buffer,
868 VSTRING_LEN(state->cmd_buffer) - 1);
869 break;
870 }
871
872 /*
873 * Yield this pseudo thread when the VSTREAM buffer is empty in
874 * the middle of a command.
875 *
876 * XXX Do not reset the read timeout. The entire command must be
877 * received within the time limit.
878 */
879 if (PSC_SMTPD_BUFFER_EMPTY(state))
880 return;
881 }
882
883 /*
884 * Terminate the command buffer, and apply the last-resort command
885 * editing workaround.
886 */
887 VSTRING_TERMINATE(state->cmd_buffer);
888 if (psc_cmd_filter != 0) {
889 const char *cp;
890
891 for (cp = STR(state->cmd_buffer); *cp && IS_SPACE_TAB(*cp); cp++)
892 /* void */ ;
893 if ((cp = psc_dict_get(psc_cmd_filter, cp)) != 0) {
894 msg_info("[%s]:%s: replacing command \"%.100s\" with \"%.100s\"",
895 state->smtp_client_addr, state->smtp_client_port,
896 STR(state->cmd_buffer), cp);
897 vstring_strcpy(state->cmd_buffer, cp);
898 } else if (psc_cmd_filter->error != 0) {
899 msg_fatal("%s:%s lookup error for \"%.100s\"",
900 psc_cmd_filter->type, psc_cmd_filter->name, cp);
901 }
902 }
903
904 /*
905 * Reset the command buffer write pointer and state machine in
906 * preparation for the next command. For this to work as expected,
907 * VSTRING_RESET() must be non-destructive. We just can't ask for the
908 * VSTRING_LEN() and vstring_end() results.
909 */
910 state->read_state = PSC_SMTPD_CMD_ST_ANY;
911 VSTRING_RESET(state->cmd_buffer);
912
913 /*
914 * Process the command line.
915 *
916 * Caution: some command handlers terminate the session and destroy the
917 * session state structure. When this happens we must leave the SMTP
918 * engine to avoid a dangling pointer problem.
919 */
920 cmd_buffer_ptr = STR(state->cmd_buffer);
921 if (msg_verbose)
922 msg_info("< [%s]:%s: %s", state->smtp_client_addr,
923 state->smtp_client_port, cmd_buffer_ptr);
924
925 /* Parse the command name. */
926 if ((command = PSC_SMTPD_NEXT_TOKEN(cmd_buffer_ptr)) == 0)
927 command = "";
928
929 /*
930 * The non-SMTP, PIPELINING and command COUNT tests depend on the
931 * client command handler.
932 *
933 * Caution: cmdp->name and cmdp->action may be null on loop exit.
934 */
935 saved_where = state->where;
936 state->where = PSC_SMTPD_CMD_UNIMPL;
937 for (cmdp = command_table; cmdp->name != 0; cmdp++) {
938 if (strcasecmp(command, cmdp->name) == 0) {
939 state->where = cmdp->name;
940 break;
941 }
942 }
943
944 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_SMTPD_X21)
945 && cmdp->action != psc_quit_cmd) {
946 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_DROP_SESSION_STATE(state, psc_smtpd_time_event,
947 state->final_reply);
948 return;
949 }
950 /* Non-SMTP command test. */
951 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_NSMTP_TODO_SKIP)
952 == PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_TODO && cmdp->name == 0
953 && (is_header(command)
954 /* Ignore forbid_cmds lookup errors. Non-critical feature. */
955 || (*var_psc_forbid_cmds
956 && string_list_match(psc_forbid_cmds, command)))) {
957 printable(command, '?');
958 PSC_SMTPD_ESCAPE_TEXT(psc_temp, cmd_buffer_ptr,
959 strlen(cmd_buffer_ptr), 100);
960 msg_info("NON-SMTP COMMAND from [%s]:%s after %s: %.100s %s",
961 PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state), saved_where,
962 command, STR(psc_temp));
963 PSC_FAIL_SESSION_STATE(state, PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_FAIL);
964 PSC_UNPASS_SESSION_STATE(state, PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_PASS);
965 state->nsmtp_stamp = PSC_TIME_STAMP_DISABLED; /* XXX */
966 /* Skip this test for the remainder of this SMTP session. */
967 PSC_SKIP_SESSION_STATE(state, "non-smtp test",
968 PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_SKIP);
969 switch (psc_nsmtp_action) {
970 case PSC_ACT_DROP:
971 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_DROP_SESSION_STATE(state,
972 psc_smtpd_time_event,
973 "521 5.7.0 Error: I can break rules, too. Goodbye.\r\n");
974 return;
975 case PSC_ACT_ENFORCE:
976 PSC_ENFORCE_SESSION_STATE(state,
977 "550 5.5.1 Protocol error\r\n");
978 break;
979 case PSC_ACT_IGNORE:
980 PSC_UNFAIL_SESSION_STATE(state,
981 PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_FAIL);
982 /* Temporarily whitelist until something else expires. */
983 PSC_PASS_SESSION_STATE(state, "non-smtp test",
984 PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_PASS);
985 state->nsmtp_stamp = event_time() + psc_min_ttl;
986 break;
987 default:
988 msg_panic("%s: unknown non_smtp_command action value %d",
989 myname, psc_nsmtp_action);
990 }
991 }
992 /* Command PIPELINING test. */
993 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_PIPEL_TODO_SKIP)
994 == PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_TODO && !PSC_SMTPD_BUFFER_EMPTY(state)) {
995 printable(command, '?');
996 PSC_SMTPD_ESCAPE_TEXT(psc_temp, PSC_SMTPD_PEEK_DATA(state),
997 PSC_SMTPD_PEEK_LEN(state), 100);
998 msg_info("COMMAND PIPELINING from [%s]:%s after %.100s: %s",
999 PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state), command, STR(psc_temp));
1000 PSC_FAIL_SESSION_STATE(state, PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_FAIL);
1001 PSC_UNPASS_SESSION_STATE(state, PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_PASS);
1002 state->pipel_stamp = PSC_TIME_STAMP_DISABLED; /* XXX */
1003 /* Skip this test for the remainder of this SMTP session. */
1004 PSC_SKIP_SESSION_STATE(state, "pipelining test",
1005 PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_SKIP);
1006 switch (psc_pipel_action) {
1007 case PSC_ACT_DROP:
1008 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_DROP_SESSION_STATE(state,
1009 psc_smtpd_time_event,
1010 "521 5.5.1 Protocol error\r\n");
1011 return;
1012 case PSC_ACT_ENFORCE:
1013 PSC_ENFORCE_SESSION_STATE(state,
1014 "550 5.5.1 Protocol error\r\n");
1015 break;
1016 case PSC_ACT_IGNORE:
1017 PSC_UNFAIL_SESSION_STATE(state,
1018 PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_FAIL);
1019 /* Temporarily whitelist until something else expires. */
1020 PSC_PASS_SESSION_STATE(state, "pipelining test",
1021 PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_PASS);
1022 state->pipel_stamp = event_time() + psc_min_ttl;
1023 break;
1024 default:
1025 msg_panic("%s: unknown pipelining action value %d",
1026 myname, psc_pipel_action);
1027 }
1028 }
1029
1030 /*
1031 * The following tests don't pass until the client gets all the way
1032 * to the RCPT TO command. However, the client can still fail these
1033 * tests with some later command.
1034 */
1035 if (cmdp->action == psc_rcpt_cmd) {
1036 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_BARLF_TODO_PASS_FAIL)
1037 == PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_TODO) {
1038 PSC_PASS_SESSION_STATE(state, "bare newline test",
1039 PSC_STATE_FLAG_BARLF_PASS);
1040 /* XXX Reset to PSC_TIME_STAMP_DISABLED on failure. */
1041 state->barlf_stamp = event_time() + var_psc_barlf_ttl;
1042 }
1043 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_NSMTP_TODO_PASS_FAIL)
1044 == PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_TODO) {
1045 PSC_PASS_SESSION_STATE(state, "non-smtp test",
1046 PSC_STATE_FLAG_NSMTP_PASS);
1047 /* XXX Reset to PSC_TIME_STAMP_DISABLED on failure. */
1048 state->nsmtp_stamp = event_time() + var_psc_nsmtp_ttl;
1049 }
1050 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_MASK_PIPEL_TODO_PASS_FAIL)
1051 == PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_TODO) {
1052 PSC_PASS_SESSION_STATE(state, "pipelining test",
1053 PSC_STATE_FLAG_PIPEL_PASS);
1054 /* XXX Reset to PSC_TIME_STAMP_DISABLED on failure. */
1055 state->pipel_stamp = event_time() + var_psc_pipel_ttl;
1056 }
1057 }
1058 /* Command COUNT limit test. */
1059 if (++state->command_count > var_psc_cmd_count
1060 && cmdp->action != psc_quit_cmd) {
1061 msg_info("COMMAND COUNT LIMIT from [%s]:%s after %s",
1062 PSC_CLIENT_ADDR_PORT(state), saved_where);
1063 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_DROP_SESSION_STATE(state, psc_smtpd_time_event,
1064 psc_smtpd_421_reply);
1065 return;
1066 }
1067 /* Finally, execute the command. */
1068 if (cmdp->name == 0 || (cmdp->flags & PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_ENABLE) == 0) {
1069 write_stat = PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
1070 "502 5.5.2 Error: command not recognized\r\n");
1071 } else if (var_psc_enforce_tls
1072 && (state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_USING_TLS) == 0
1073 && (cmdp->flags & PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_PRE_TLS) == 0) {
1074 write_stat = PSC_SEND_REPLY(state,
1075 "530 5.7.0 Must issue a STARTTLS command first\r\n");
1076 } else {
1077 write_stat = cmdp->action(state, cmd_buffer_ptr);
1078 if (cmdp->flags & PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_DESTROY)
1079 return;
1080 }
1081
1082 /*
1083 * Terminate the session after a write error.
1084 */
1085 if (write_stat < 0) {
1086 PSC_CLEAR_EVENT_HANGUP(state, psc_smtpd_time_event);
1087 return;
1088 }
1089
1090 /*
1091 * We're suspended, waiting for some external event to happen.
1092 * Hopefully, someone will call us back to process the remainder of
1093 * the pending input, otherwise we could hang.
1094 */
1095 if (cmdp->flags & PSC_SMTPD_CMD_FLAG_SUSPEND)
1096 return;
1097
1098 /*
1099 * Reset the command read timeout before reading the next command.
1100 */
1101 event_request_timer(psc_smtpd_time_event, (void *) state,
1102 PSC_EFF_CMD_TIME_LIMIT);
1103
1104 /*
1105 * Yield this pseudo thread when the VSTREAM buffer is empty.
1106 */
1107 if (PSC_SMTPD_BUFFER_EMPTY(state))
1108 return;
1109 }
1110}
1111
1112/* psc_smtpd_tests - per-session deep protocol test initialization */
1113
1114void psc_smtpd_tests(PSC_STATE *state)
1115{
1116 static char *myname = "psc_smtpd_tests";
1117
1118 /*
1119 * Report errors and progress in the context of this test.
1120 */
1121 PSC_BEGIN_TESTS(state, "tests after SMTP handshake");
1122
1123 /*
1124 * Initialize per-session state that is used only by the dummy engine:
1125 * the command read buffer and the command read state machine.
1126 */
1127 state->cmd_buffer = vstring_alloc(100);
1128 state->read_state = PSC_SMTPD_CMD_ST_ANY;
1129
1130 /*
1131 * Opportunistically make postscreen more useful by turning on the
1132 * pipelining and non-SMTP command tests when a pre-handshake test
1133 * failed, or when some deep test is configured as enabled.
1134 *
1135 * XXX Make "opportunistically" configurable for each test.
1136 */
1137 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_SMTPD_X21) == 0) {
1138 state->flags |= PSC_STATE_MASK_SMTPD_TODO;
1139 } else {
1140 state->flags &= ~PSC_STATE_MASK_SMTPD_TODO;
1141 }
1142
1143 /*
1144 * Send no SMTP banner to pregreeting clients. This eliminates a lot of
1145 * "NON-SMTP COMMAND" events, and improves sender/recipient logging.
1146 */
1147 if ((state->flags & PSC_STATE_FLAG_PREGR_FAIL) == 0
1148 && PSC_SEND_REPLY(state, psc_smtpd_greeting) != 0) {
1149 psc_hangup_event(state);
1150 return;
1151 }
1152
1153 /*
1154 * Wait for the client to respond.
1155 */
1156 PSC_READ_EVENT_REQUEST2(vstream_fileno(state->smtp_client_stream),
1157 psc_smtpd_read_event, psc_smtpd_time_event,
1158 (void *) state, PSC_EFF_CMD_TIME_LIMIT);
1159}
1160
1161/* psc_smtpd_init - per-process deep protocol test initialization */
1162
1163void psc_smtpd_init(void)
1164{
1165
1166 /*
1167 * Initialize the server banner.
1168 */
1169 vstring_sprintf(psc_temp, "220 %s\r\n", var_smtpd_banner);
1170 psc_smtpd_greeting = mystrdup(STR(psc_temp));
1171
1172 /*
1173 * Initialize the HELO reply.
1174 */
1175 vstring_sprintf(psc_temp, "250 %s\r\n", var_myhostname);
1176 psc_smtpd_helo_reply = mystrdup(STR(psc_temp));
1177
1178 /*
1179 * STARTTLS support. Note the complete absence of #ifdef USE_TLS
1180 * throughout the postscreen(8) source code. If Postfix is built without
1181 * TLS support, then the TLS proxy will simply report that TLS is not
1182 * available, and conventional error handling will take care of the
1183 * issue.
1184 *
1185 * Legacy code copied from smtpd(8). The pre-fabricated EHLO reply depends
1186 * on this.
1187 */
1188 if (*var_psc_tls_level) {
1189 switch (tls_level_lookup(var_psc_tls_level)) {
1190 default:
1191 msg_fatal("Invalid TLS level \"%s\"", var_psc_tls_level);
1192 /* NOTREACHED */
1193 break;
1194 case TLS_LEV_SECURE:
1195 case TLS_LEV_VERIFY:
1196 case TLS_LEV_FPRINT:
1197 msg_warn("%s: unsupported TLS level \"%s\", using \"encrypt\"",
1198 VAR_PSC_TLS_LEVEL, var_psc_tls_level);
1199 /* FALLTHROUGH */
1200 case TLS_LEV_ENCRYPT:
1201 var_psc_enforce_tls = var_psc_use_tls = 1;
1202 break;
1203 case TLS_LEV_MAY:
1204 var_psc_enforce_tls = 0;
1205 var_psc_use_tls = 1;
1206 break;
1207 case TLS_LEV_NONE:
1208 var_psc_enforce_tls = var_psc_use_tls = 0;
1209 break;
1210 }
1211 }
1212 var_psc_use_tls = var_psc_use_tls || var_psc_enforce_tls;
1213#ifdef TODO_SASL_AUTH
1214 var_psc_tls_auth_only = var_psc_tls_auth_only || var_psc_enforce_tls;
1215#endif
1216
1217 /*
1218 * Initialize the EHLO reply. Once for plaintext sessions, and once for
1219 * TLS sessions.
1220 */
1221 psc_smtpd_format_ehlo_reply(psc_temp, psc_ehlo_discard_mask);
1222 psc_smtpd_ehlo_reply_plain = mystrdup(STR(psc_temp));
1223
1224 psc_smtpd_format_ehlo_reply(psc_temp,
1225 psc_ehlo_discard_mask | EHLO_MASK_STARTTLS);
1226 psc_smtpd_ehlo_reply_tls = mystrdup(STR(psc_temp));
1227
1228 /*
1229 * Initialize the 421 timeout reply.
1230 */
1231 vstring_sprintf(psc_temp, "421 4.4.2 %s Error: timeout exceeded\r\n",
1232 var_myhostname);
1233 psc_smtpd_timeout_reply = mystrdup(STR(psc_temp));
1234
1235 /*
1236 * Initialize the generic 421 reply.
1237 */
1238 vstring_sprintf(psc_temp, "421 %s Service unavailable - try again later\r\n",
1239 var_myhostname);
1240 psc_smtpd_421_reply = mystrdup(STR(psc_temp));
1241
1242 /*
1243 * Initialize the reply footer.
1244 */
1245 if (*var_psc_rej_footer)
1246 psc_expand_init();
1247}
1248
1249/* psc_smtpd_pre_jail_init - per-process deep protocol test initialization */
1250
1251void psc_smtpd_pre_jail_init(void)
1252{
1253
1254 /*
1255 * Determine what server ESMTP features to suppress, typically to avoid
1256 * inter-operability problems. We do the default filter here, and
1257 * determine client-dependent filtering on the fly.
1258 *
1259 * XXX Bugger. This means we have to restart when the table changes!
1260 */
1261 if (*var_psc_ehlo_dis_maps)
1262 psc_ehlo_discard_maps = maps_create(VAR_PSC_EHLO_DIS_MAPS,
1263 var_psc_ehlo_dis_maps,
1264 DICT_FLAG_LOCK);
1265 psc_ehlo_discard_mask = ehlo_mask(var_psc_ehlo_dis_words);
1266
1267 /*
1268 * Last-resort command editing support.
1269 */
1270 if (*var_psc_cmd_filter)
1271 psc_cmd_filter = dict_open(var_psc_cmd_filter, O_RDONLY,
1272 DICT_FLAG_LOCK | DICT_FLAG_FOLD_FIX);
1273}
